article.title: Toonz Animation India
article.text:
{{Short description|Animation company}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=November 2018}} '''Toonz Animation India Pvt. Ltd.''' is an animation company in India. It is the animation arm of the Singapore-based Toonz Group, which has diverse interests in production and distribution of live-action feature films, digital and gaming content, licensing and merchandising, and media-related education.{{cite web|url=http://www.afaqs.com/news/story/5751_Cartoon-Network-acquires-two-new-Indian-animated-series-from-Toonz-Animation |title=Cartoon Network acquires two new Indian animated series from Toonz Animation > afaqs! news & features |publisher=Afaqs.com |date=27 February 2003 |access-date=17 August 2013}}{{cite web|author=Nita Sathyendran |url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/animated-adventures/article4101912.ece |title=Animated adventures |work=The Hindu |date=16 November 2012 |access-date=17 August 2013}} Toonz Animation was started in 1999 by [[G. A. Menon]] and Bill Dennis, who had worked on [[Disney|Disney's]] ''[[The Little Mermaid (1989 film)|The Little Mermaid]]'', ''[[Beauty and the Beast (1991 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'' and ''[[Aladdin (1992 Disney film)|Aladdin]]''. Toonz Animation is located in [[Thiruvananthapuram]] (Trivandrum), the capital city of [[Kerala]]. Its office is currently situated in the [[Technopark, Kerala|Technopark]]; it is expanding to a new {{convert|2.5|acre|m2|adj=on}} campus in the Kinfra Film and Video Park in Trivandrum. Major projects on which Toonz Animation has worked include ''[[The Adventures of Tenali Raman]]'', ''[[Return of Hanuman]]'', ''[[Freefonix]]'', ''[[Wolverine and the X-Men (TV series)|Wolverine and the X-Men]]'', ''[[Dragonlance: Dragons of Autumn Twilight]]'', ''[[Kid Krrish]]'', and ''[[Gaturro]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/mp/2003/02/24/stories/2003022400240200.htm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20031114185542/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/mp/2003/02/24/stories/2003022400240200.htm |url-status=dead |archive-date=14 November 2003 |title=Cartoons jump the 'desi' wagon |date=24 February 2003 |work=[[The Hindu]] |access-date=17 August 2013}} Toonz Animation is also the producer of the popular cricket based 2D animated teleseries ''[[Howzzattt]]''. ''[[Gaturro (film)|Gaturro(film)]]'' a 90-minute 3D-animation feature film, including character design has been done in the Toonz Animation studio at [[Technopark, Kerala|Technopark]] Campus, [[Trivandrum, Kerala]]. Toonz Animation operates and promotes a number of digital channels, including the noted [[Chotoonz TV]], a digital channel for kids cartoon videos with more than two million subscribers and 1.75 billion views. Toonz channels are available on [[YouTube]], [[Dailymotion]], [[Amazon Prime]], [[Roku]] and other digital platforms. Toonz Animation organizes an industry event called [[Animation Masters Summit]] every year. The event brings together top industry experts, vibrant animation professionals and aspiring young minds together to discuss trends and initiatives shaping the global animation industry.{{cite news | url=https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/toonz-to-hold-animation-masters-summit-115040100756_1.html | title=Toonz to hold Animation Masters Summit | date=1 April 2015 | author=IANS | newspaper=Business Standard | access-date=6 November 2018 }} ==Filmography== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | Film ! scope="col" | Director ! scope="col" | Notes |- | 2007 | ''[[Return of Hanuman]]'' | [[Anurag Kashyap]] | Co-produced with [[Percept Picture Company]] |- | 2008 | ''[[Dragonlance: Dragons of Autumn Twilight]]'' | [[Will Meugniot]] | [[Direct-to-video]] film |- | 2010 | ''[[Gaturro (film)|Gaturro]]'' | Gustavo Cova | Co-produced with [[Ánima Estudios]] and [[Illusion Studios]] |- | 2012 | ''[[Swami Ayyappan (2012 film)|Swami Ayyappan]]'' | Chetan Sharma
Mahesh Vettiyar | Co-produced with Animagic |- | 2013 | ''[[Speed Racer: Race to the Future]]'' | Robert H. Fuentes III | Direct-to-video film
